intro: Mollia intricata, commonly known as the intricate mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Mollia intricata is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
